body:
To be clear, I understand why there is a need for the type of validation that is currently provided: [ensuring that an argument is one of the authorized values in a given enum](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/70d531ff4c1ae3980615cee07a948fe49b1bc7cf/pydantic/validators.py#L248).

But there is also a need to be able to check that an argument is an instance of `Enum`, without caring about what the keys and values of that `Enum` are.

issue.title: feat(field): add `Enum` and `IntEnum` as valid types for fields

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
_This is a proposal as I agree with the author of the issue. Feel free to close it if need be_

## Change Summary
Support `Enum` type as follows

```python
class Model(BaseModel):
    fruit: Enum
```

## Related issue number

closes #1735

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

body:
Hi @zabzug-pfpt 
I agree with you it should be a valid syntax. I opened a PR to add a basic support of `Enum` as valid type.
Feel free to try it out.
Thanks so much @PrettyWood! I added one small testing comment on your PR, otherwise it looks good!

issue.title: Integer enum query parameters validation always fails

repository.name: fastapi
repository.description: FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production

issue.body:
### First check

* [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
* [x] I used the GitHub search to find a similar issue and didn't find it.
* [x] I searched the FastAPI documentation, with the integrated search.
* [x] I already searched in Google "How to X in FastAPI" and didn't find any information.
* [x] I already read and followed all the tutorial in the docs and didn't find an answer.
* [x] I already checked if it is not related to FastAPI but to [Pydantic](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic).
* [x] I already checked if it is not related to FastAPI but to [Swagger UI](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-ui).
* [x] I already checked if it is not related to FastAPI but to [ReDoc](https://github.com/Redocly/redoc).
* [x] After submitting this, I commit to one of:
    * Read open issues with questions until I find 2 issues where I can help someone and add a comment to help there.
    * I already hit the "watch" button in this repository to receive notifications and I commit to help at least 2 people that ask questions in the future.
    * Implement a Pull Request for a confirmed bug.

### Example

Here's a self-contained, [minimal, reproducible, example](https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example) with my use case:

```Python
from enum import Enum
from fastapi import FastAPI

app = FastAPI()


class Category(int, Enum):
    MISC = 0
    LIFE = 1
    CODE = 2
    GUIDES = 3
    PROJECTS = 4


@app.get("/stuff")
def read_root(category: Category):
    return {"Hello": "World"}
```

Run `$uvicorn test:app`

### Description

* Open the browser and call the endpoint `/stuff?category=1`.
* It returns a 422 error `"value is not a valid enumeration member; permitted: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4"` even though the correct int enum value is provided. 
* **Expected:** It returns a JSON with `{"Hello": "World"}`.

### Environment

* OS: macOS
* FastAPI Version: 0.61.1
* Python version: 3.8.5

### Additional context

I've looked through all pydantic issues, found [this one](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/1735), but I don't know if it's related, or what it's current status (whether it has been resolved).

body:
This is not the exact scenario in the issue, but there is still a problem in the case where there is a middle class inheriting from enum without specifying values. If you have something like

```python
class SpecialEnum(Enum):
    def do_stuff(self):
         # some cool operation

class MySpecialEnum(SpecialDescriptorEnum):
   A = 1
   B = 2 

class MyModel(BaseModel):
    my_field: SpecialEnum
```
then
```python
MyModel(my_field=MySpecialEnum.A)
```
Will throw a `ValidationError`.

I want pydantic to validate that my_field is some instance of a SpecialEnum subclass.
However, pydantic uses its enum member validator instead, resulting in what will always be a `ValidationError` â€” since SpecialEnum was only ever meant to provide functionality or interface, and not values.

issue.title: Use isinstance enum validator for 0-members enums

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
Bugfix for 1.10.2.

Tiny change to solve a left-over problem in from #1735 where "middle" enum subclasses used to override or provide methods instead of setting members could not be validated

body: Let's look at getting this right in v2. We can't change it before then.
